title: Mozart - Symphony in E Flat Major, Symphony in D Major Prague
description: Mozart's use of abundant emotion and contrasting elements in his Symphony E Flat Major K 543 finally allowed him to step out from the shadow of the symphonic priest Joseph Haydn.
Composed between Le Nozze di Figaro and Don Giovanni, the "Prague" Symphony plays with thematic citations from these two big italian operas.
The Deutsche Kammerphilharmonie Bremen is one of the worlds leading chamber orchestras and this interesting study of Gerd Albrechts and David Zinmans conducting styles is an eyecatcher.
Recorded in 1991. Picture Format: 4:3  Subtitles: D, F, GB, SP Sound Format: PCM Stereo
